channel.title: Comments on: The Weeknd – Party Monster

item.title: By: Cody
item.dc:creator: Cody
item.description: The entire Starboy album really hit me in the right way, between this & Awaken, My Love! (which is my second favorite album of 2016), this has been a good few weeks for music, if nothing else.
item.content:encoded: The entire Starboy album really hit me in the right way, between this & Awaken, My Love! (which is my second favorite album of 2016), this has been a good few weeks for music, if nothing else.

item.title: By: Andrew
item.dc:creator: Andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2016/11/the-weeknd-party-monster/#comment-434776">Eric</a>.
Anderson Paak's Album is called Malibu, I recommend checking it out, he was also on this years XXL Freshman Cypher 2016 with Lil Dicky and Desiigner, but he mostly does R&B and soul, which surprised me that he made the list, but he is actually a dope rapper too, so it make sense.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Eric.

Anderson Paak’s Album is called Malibu, I recommend checking it out, he was also on this years XXL Freshman Cypher 2016 with Lil Dicky and Desiigner, but he mostly does R&B and soul, which surprised me that he made the list, but he is actually a dope rapper too, so it make sense.

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2016/11/the-weeknd-party-monster/#comment-434774">Andrew</a>.
The NxWorries album? I gave it a listen and it's jazzy and smooth, quite a different style. I haven't heard of Anderson Paak before.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Andrew.

The NxWorries album? I gave it a listen and it’s jazzy and smooth, quite a different style. I haven’t heard of Anderson Paak before.

item.title: By: Andrew
item.dc:creator: Andrew
item.description: I liked the album after like 10 play throughs, but I still feel the Anderson Paak album was way better, and one of my favorite albums to come out this year.
item.content:encoded: I liked the album after like 10 play throughs, but I still feel the Anderson Paak album was way better, and one of my favorite albums to come out this year.
